instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437B Not charging
threads.message:
Hi Team,
I've this board that is not charging , no sign of WD, and already swapped battery

With the battery connected and the board ON :
ppbus: 8.37V
activity on SCL and SDA lines
pin 4 of Q7155 is mesuring 0.969V then pulsing to 8.35V in cycle.....which doesn't allow the battery to charge.
Also when the mba is OFF the board is not pulling power: 0.008A and at Pin4 of Q7155 it clycling between 0V to 7V in loop and clycles also at pin 5 from 0V to 5V
Already replaced Q7155 and U5601: without succes
I'm suspecting U7000 or upstream, have to find the reason of that interruption on pin 4 of Q7155......

threads.title: 820-3437B Not charging
threads.message:
OSX reports battery percentage?
Does it start on battery alone?
Use another battery, with some charge, for this test; if original is drained.

Post CHGR_A/BMON with board on/off and battery present and not.

threads.title: 820-3437B Not charging
threads.message:
Yes OSX reports percentage
Yes it's starting with the battery alone
I'm using a battery charged at 70%

Board OFF with Battery Only:
CHGR_AMON: 0.00V
CHGR_BMON: 0.049V

Board ON with Battery Only:
CHGR_AMON: 0.00V
CHGR_BMON: 0.100V

Board OFF with Battery and Charger:
CHGR_AMON: 0.660V
CHGR_BMON: 0.00V

Board ON with Battery and Charger:
CHGR_AMON: 0.880V
CHGR_BMON: 0.49V

threads.title: 820-3437B Not charging
threads.message:
"CHGR_BMON: 0.49V"
Looks like battery is charging.
At least this signal shows battery receives current from MLB.
Unless you have a problem with R7150-52, or traces to pins 17/18 of U7100.

threads.title: 820-3437B Not charging
threads.message:
I checked the resistance R17/18 and it's ok: around 3 Ohms.
I've seen like a short between pin 15 and 16 of U7100 and reflowed as shown in the attached pictures, I've also resoldered J6950, but it didn't solved the issue.

[ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	20190922-132545-860.jpg Views:	0 Size:	71.3 KB ID:	52484" type="full" width="30%"]52486._xfImport[/ATTACH][ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	Full Logo.jpg Views:	0 Size:	11.5 KB ID:	52487" type="full" width="30%"]52487._xfImport[/ATTACH]

I've noticed that with the battery completly empty I'm reading 8.55V for PPVBAT_G3H_CONN, usually when the battery is not full it should mesure under ppbus (8.55V) , like between 7V to 8.55V no?
It's acting like the battery is full no?

threads.title: 820-3437B Not charging
threads.message:
Hi,
Just to let you know that the problem is fixed.
Now with the board ON it's pulling almost 3 Amps, CHGR_BGATE stays low and pulsing like before.
I can see the percentage rising quite fast.
I fact, I think that in all the things I did, one of them solved the issue except that the battery was continiouly showing 1%. This one is dead.
So I replaced it with another one now it's charging normally.

Again thanks for your support and patience

You can set this Topic as Solved. but i you could just answser to the question regarding the battery logos......thanks

Best Regards

threads.title: 820-3437B Not charging
threads.message:
Left side logo shows battery is charging.
Right side not charging, probably "Replace now" advice in drop down list menu for battery...
